title: Is cyanobacteria a bacteria or an algae? - Quora

response.answer_text: Though they are generally referred to as blue-green algae, they are actually prokaryotic, lack well defined nucleus and organells, unlike algae which are eukaryotic. So, cyanobacteria is the technically correct name.
Procaryotic bacteria that photosynthesize… are cyanobacteria… Procaryotic bacteria that do not…all all the rest. 2 groups of bacteria…one like plants…the other like animals.
